subject: Law
title: The First Amendment
description: A micro-lesson that makes The First Amendment usable.

hook.text: A teenager wore a black armband to school in protest. The school suspended her. The Supreme Court sided with her.

buildup.text: The First Amendment protects speech, religion, press, assembly, and the right to petition government.

discovery.text: In Tinker v. Des Moines, the Court ruled students don't shed their rights at the schoolhouse gate.

twist.text: Free speech isn't absolute. Threats, fraud, and incitement to violence fall outside its protection.

climax.text: Courts constantly draw that line between protected expression and harmful speech.

punchline.text: Free speech protects the speech you hate, not just the speech you like.

quiz.question: What did Tinker v. Des Moines establish?
options: Students have no rights at school
Students retain free speech rights at school
